Sentencas: Direct methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs) operated under catalytic partial oxidation (CPOX) conditions are investigated, focusing on the processing of the anode support and the anode deactivation caused by carbon deposition.
Titulo: Direct-methane anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells fabricated by aqueous gel-casting

Sentencas: Anode-supported SOFCs based on gadolinium-doped ceria (GDC) electrolyte, and NiO-GDC anode support were fabricated by the gel-casting method.
Titulo: Direct-methane anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells fabricated by aqueous gel-casting

Sentencas: Suitable aqueous slurries formulations of NiO-GDC were prepared, starting NiO-GDC nanocomposite powders, agarose as gelling agent and rice starch as pore former.
Titulo: Direct-methane anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells fabricated by aqueous gel-casting

Sentencas: Electrochemical and mechanical tests evidenced that the support of 550 +/- 50 mu m thickness and 10 wt% pore former is a good candidate for direct-methane SOFCs.
Titulo: Direct-methane anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells fabricated by aqueous gel-casting

Sentencas: The cells operating under stoichiometric conditions of CPOX reached a performance of 0.64 W.cm(-2) at 650 degrees C, a very close value to that measured under humidified hydrogen (0.71 W.cm(-2)).
Titulo: Direct-methane anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells fabricated by aqueous gel-casting

Sentencas: The best electrochemical stability of the cell is achieved at a CH4/O-2 ratio of 2.5, showing no evidence of carbon deposition and reducing nickel re-oxidation significantly.
Titulo: Direct-methane anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells fabricated by aqueous gel-casting
